body_text:
In certain situations we are going to be looking for changes in attitudinal feedback based on different values available in Telemetry. It would be nice if we could pass the values of interesting prefs in as URL params to Survey Gizmo. That would allow us to do custom survey logic to alter the order/phrasing/reponse types of individual questions based on these values. This is not possible with the current system of merging on telemetry AFTER the survey is complete. This method will significantly decrease the amount of analysis time for these surveys as well.
Use cases:


I ran a pref flipping experiment to change the value of nglayout.intial.paintdelay. The default value is 350ms but setting it to 0 should make users feel like Firefox is faster. I put out a Heartbeat survey and in the jexl I limit it to only users with that experiment id.


I want to know if having the dev toolbar open is a good predictor of being a developer. I want to split my survey based on the value of dev.toolbar.open


I want to know if people that restore the previous session are happier than people that always get the home page on startup. So I want to compare the values of browser.startup.page


cc @gregglind @rayborn anything else you want to add?
